SEARCH
Package ygong.APS

Class Schedule.OrderWithTime

java.lang.Object
ygong.APS.Schedule.OrderWithTime
Enclosing class:
Schedule
public static class Schedule.OrderWithTime extends Object
Helper class for Orders

The class that takes the original Order as a reference and have additional start time, end time, and status for schedule checking.

We have four status for an order:
0b00 for on time(GREEN), the order is normally executed, it doesn't violate any time constraints(EST, LDT, delivery)
0b01 for violate LDT(RED), the order is executed after the latest due time(LDT)
0b10 for violate EST(PURPLE), the order is executed before the earliest start time(EST)
0b11 for violate delivery(MAGENTA), the order is executed after the delivery time

Note: if memory size is not big issue, we can extend Order class. But for memory efficiency, we use composition by reference
Note: All the time variables in Order/OrderWithTime is in integer format, which may not enough for precision. We can change to double format if needed.
See Also:

    order

    private int
    status
    bitwise status (1 for true, 0 for false) last two digits are used for schedule status
    schedule status status description color code 0b00 on time status-green 0b01 Latest Due Time violate status-red 0b10 Earliest Start Time violate status-est-violate 0b11 Delivery Time violate status-deli-violate
    Note: other digits are not used (for now), change to enum if needed

      status description color code
      0b00 on time status-green
      0b01 Latest Due Time violate status-red
      0b10 Earliest Start Time violate status-est-violate
      0b11 Delivery Time violate status-deli-violate

      Note: other digits are not used (for now), change to enum if needed
